items.title: CCTV Technician Knowledge Base
items.text:
Welcome to the comprehensive CCTV technician reference guide. This knowledge base provides detailed documentation for major CCTV system brands, including setup guides, configuration references, and troubleshooting procedures.

Quick Navigation

  • Hanwha Wisenet Cheatsheet
  • Dahua Technology Guide
  • Hikvision Reference Manual

items.title: Featured Documentation
items.text:
Hanwha WisenetDahua TechnologyHikvision

Comprehensive guide to Hanwha Wisenet CCTV systems, including: - Network configuration - Camera setup and management - NVR configuration - Troubleshooting guides

View Hanwha Documentation →

Complete reference for Dahua CCTV systems, featuring: - Installation procedures - Smart features setup - Mobile access configuration - Firmware management

View Dahua Documentation →

Detailed documentation for Hikvision products, including: - Initial setup and activation - Advanced configuration - Security best practices - Common issues and solutions

View Hikvision Documentation →

items.title: For New Installations
items.text:
1. Choose Your System
  2. Review the specifications and features of each brand

  3. Select the system that best fits your requirements

  4. Basic Setup

  5. Follow the quick start guide for your chosen system
  6. Configure network settings

  7. Set up initial camera views

  8. Advanced Configuration

  9. Configure recording schedules
  10. Set up motion detection
  11. Enable remote access

items.title: Troubleshooting
items.text:
Common issues and solutions:

  • Camera Not Detected
  • Verify power and network connections
  • Check IP address configuration

  • Ensure firmware is up to date

  • Poor Video Quality

  • Adjust resolution and bitrate settings
  • Check network bandwidth

  • Inspect camera lens and housing

  • Remote Access Issues

  • Verify port forwarding settings
  • Check firewall configuration
  • Confirm account permissions

items.title: Documentation
items.text:
• Hanwha Technical Resources
  • Dahua Documentation
  • Hikvision Support

items.title: Tools
items.text:
• SADP Tool
  • Dahua ConfigTool
  • Wisenet Device Manager

items.title: Need Help?
items.text:
If you can't find what you're looking for or need assistance:

  • Check the FAQ section in each brand's documentation
  • Search for specific topics using the search bar
  • Contact Support for personalized assistance

Last Updated: Nov 2025

items.title: Dahua CCTV Technician Cheatsheet
items.text:
Quick Navigation

  • Quick Reference
  • Default Credentials
  • Network Configuration
  • Camera Setup
  • NVR Configuration
  • Common Commands
  • Troubleshooting
  • Mobile Access

items.title: Quick Reference
items.text:
Network PortsCommon IP Ranges Port Protocol Service 80 TCP HTTP 443 TCP HTTPS 554 TCP/UDP RTSP 80 TCP ONVIF 37777 TCP Dahua P2P 443 TCP Dahua Cloud 37777 UDP Dahua Media 37777 TCP Mobile Access
  • 192.168.1.x - Default network
  • 10.0.0.x - Common alternative network
  • 172.16.0.x - Common alternative network

items.title: Default Credentials
items.text:
Security Notice

Always change default credentials immediately after first login. These are well-known defaults. Newer Dahua firmware enforces password changes on first login.

Common DefaultsOlder Models Username Password Access Level admin admin Administrator admin 123456 Administrator admin 1111111 Administrator operator 1234 Operator 888888 888888 User 
# Common Default Combinations
- admin / admin
- admin / 123456
- admin / 1111111
- admin / 888888
- admin / 666666
- admin / admin123
- admin / 12345
- admin / 1234

items.title: IP Address Assignment
items.text:
DHCP (Default)Static IP 
# Most devices come with DHCP enabled by default
# To verify IP assignment:
ipconfig /all      # Windows
ifconfig           # Linux/macOS

# Find Dahua devices on network:
arp -a | findstr "dahua"

1. Access web interface (http://[device-ip])
2. Navigate to Configuration > Network > TCP/IP
3. Configure settings:
   - IP Address: 192.168.1.x
   - Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
   - Gateway: 192.168.1.1
   - DNS: 8.8.8.8 / 8.8.4.4
4. Apply changes and reboot if required

items.title: Port Forwarding
items.text:
Security Consideration

Consider using VPN instead of port forwarding for remote access. If port forwarding is necessary, use non-standard external ports.

Router ConfigurationFirewall Rules 
External Port: 80 (HTTP) or 443 (HTTPS)
Internal Port: 80
Protocol: TCP
Internal IP: [Device IP]

# Allow incoming traffic
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 554 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 37777 -j ACCEPT

items.title: Initial Setup
items.text:
1. Physical Installation

  • Mount the camera in desired location
  • Connect to power (PoE or separate power supply)
  • Verify network connectivity with link lights

2. Device Detection

# Use Dahua ConfigTool to find the camera
# Download from: https://www.dahuasecurity.com/support/tools
# Run as administrator for full functionality

# Alternative: Use arp-scan (Linux/macOS)
sudo arp-scan --localnet | grep -i dahua

3. Initial Configuration

  1. Access web interface at http://[camera-ip]
  2. Complete first-time setup wizard
  3. Set strong admin password (12+ characters recommended)
  4. Configure network settings (static IP recommended)
  5. Set correct time zone and NTP server

items.title: Camera Settings
items.text:
Video SettingsImage SettingsNetwork Settings 
# Recommended Settings:
Resolution: 1080p (1920x1080) or higher
Frame Rate: 15-30 FPS
Bitrate: 4096-8192 kbps
Compression: H.265+ (recommended)
I-Frame Interval: 30 (or 2x frame rate)

# Day/Night Settings:
Mode: Auto
ICR: Auto
BLC: On for backlit scenes
WDR: On (adjust level as needed)

# Image Adjustment:
Brightness: 50
Contrast: 50
Saturation: 50
Sharpness: 50

# Recommended Configuration:
IP Assignment: Static
MTU: 1500 (default)
QoS: Enable for video traffic
HTTP/HTTPS Port: 80/443
RTSP Port: 554
  • Smart Codec: Enable for better storage efficiency

items.title: Adding Cameras
items.text:
Before You Begin

  • Ensure all cameras are on the same network segment
  • Verify camera credentials
  • Check firmware compatibility
Auto DiscoveryManual Addition 
1. Go to Camera > Registration
2. Click "Auto Search"
3. Select cameras to add
4. Enter camera credentials
5. Click "Add"

1. Go to Camera > Registration
2. Click "Add" > "IP Camera"
3. Enter camera details:
   - IP Address
   - Port (default: 80/HTTP, 443/HTTPS)
   - Protocol: ONVIF or Private
   - Username/Password

items.title: Storage & Recording
items.text:
Storage SetupRetention Settings 
# Storage Configuration:
HDD Management: RAID 5 (recommended for redundancy)
HDD Groups: 
  - Group 1: Cameras 1-8 (if using multiple HDDs)
  - Group 2: Cameras 9-16

# Recording Schedule:
- Continuous: 24/7 for critical areas
- Motion: For storage efficiency
- Event: For specific triggers

# Recommended Settings:
- 30 days retention (minimum)
- Auto-overwrite oldest when full
- Enable H.265+ for better compression
- Adjust bitrate based on storage needs

items.title: Live View Configuration
items.text:
# View Layouts:
- 1x1, 2x2, 3x3, 4x4, 5+5, 6+4, 8+8, etc.
- Custom layouts available

# Display Options:
- Digital Zoom: Up to 16x
- PTZ Controls: On-screen joystick
- Audio: Two-way audio support
- Tour: Create camera tours

items.title: Web Interface URLs
items.text:
• Main interface: http://[IP-ADDRESS]
  • ONVIF: http://[IP-ADDRESS]/onvif/device_service
  • RTSP Stream:
  • Main stream: rtsp://[USER]:[PASSWORD]@[IP-ADDRESS]:554/cam/realmonitor?channel=1&subtype=0
  • Sub stream: rtsp://[USER]:[PASSWORD]@[IP-ADDRESS]:554/cam/realmonitor?channel=1&subtype=1

items.title: Dahua ConfigTool
items.text:
• Download from: Dahua Download Center
  • Used for:
  • Device discovery
  • Batch configuration
  • Firmware updates
  • Password recovery
  • Network configuration

items.title: Common Issues & Solutions
items.text:
Camera Not FoundLogin IssuesVideo Quality Problems

Check these first

  1. Verify power and network cables
  2. Check switch/router port status
  3. Ensure IP is in correct subnet
# Network Diagnostics
ping [CAMERA_IP]
arp -a | findstr [CAMERA_MAC]
nmap -p 80,443,554 [CAMERA_IP]

# Reset network settings to default
# (Hold reset button for 30 seconds)

Security Notice

  • Try default credentials first
  • If locked out, factory reset may be required
  • Document new credentials securely
# Common Defaults
admin / admin
admin / 123456
admin / 1111111
admin / 888888

# Common Fixes:
- Increase bitrate (min 4096 kbps for 1080p)
- Lower frame rate (15 FPS is often sufficient)
- Enable H.265+/Smart Codec
- Check network bandwidth
- Verify switch supports Gigabit Ethernet
- Adjust WDR/BLC settings for challenging lighting

items.title: Factory Reset Procedures
items.text:
CamerasNVRs 
1. Locate reset button (pinhole)
2. Press and hold for 30+ seconds
3. Wait for IR LEDs to blink
4. Release and wait for reboot

1. Power off the NVR
2. Press and hold reset button
3. Power on while holding button
4. Continue holding for 30 seconds
5. Release and wait for boot

items.title: Log Collection
items.text:
For Technical Support

Always collect these logs when opening a support case:

# System Logs
http://[IP]/cgi-bin/magicBox.cgi?action=getSystemInfo

# Event Logs
http://[IP]/cgi-bin/eventManager.cgi?action=attach&codes=[All]

# Network Configuration
http://[IP]/cgi-bin/configManager.cgi?action=getConfig&name=Network

items.title: Update Procedure
items.text:
Important

Always backup configuration before updating firmware. Never power off during update.

Web InterfaceConfigTool 
1. Download firmware from Dahua Support
2. Log in to web interface
3. Go to Maintenance > System > Upgrade
4. Upload firmware file
5. Click "Upgrade" and wait for completion

1. Select device(s) in ConfigTool
2. Right-click > Upgrade
3. Select firmware file
4. Click "Start Upgrade"
5. Monitor progress and wait for reboot

items.title: Version Compatibility
items.text: Device Type Minimum Version Recommended Version IPC-HDW V2.800.0000000.1.R V4.001.0000000.1.R NVR52XX V3.200.0000000.0 V4.002.0000000.0 NVR58XX V3.200.0000000.0 V4.002.0000000.0

items.title: DMSS App
items.text:
Best Practices

  • Use P2P for easy remote access
  • Enable 2FA for security
  • Configure push notifications
  • Set up motion detection alerts
Setup GuideTroubleshooting 
1. Install DMSS from App Store/Play Store
2. Tap "+" to add device
3. Choose connection method:
   - Scan QR code (easiest)
   - Manual entry (IP/Domain)
   - P2P (cloud-based)
4. Enter credentials
5. Save and connect

# Common Issues:
- Port forwarding not configured
- Firewall blocking connection
- Incorrect credentials
- Firmware version mismatch
- P2P service not enabled

# Test Connection:
- Verify port is open: telnet [IP] [PORT]
- Check router logs
- Test with mobile data (bypass local network)

items.title: Official Documentation
items.text:
Technical ResourcesLearning & Support
  • Product Manuals
  • Firmware Downloads
  • API Documentation
  • Training Portal
  • Video Tutorials

items.title: Community & Support
items.text:
Online CommunitiesContact Support
  • Dahua Community
  • Reddit r/cctv
  • IPVM Forum
  • Submit a Ticket
  • Phone: +1-877-511-4820
  • Email: support@dahuasecurity.com

items.title: Security Checklist
items.text:
Essential Security Measures

  • Change default passwords
  • Enable HTTPS
  • Update firmware regularly
  • Use strong user passwords
  • Enable account lockout
  • Disable unused services (UPnP, P2P if not needed)
  • Enable logging
  • Regular backups

items.title: Maintenance ScheduleNeed Help?
items.text:
Task Frequency Notes Firmware Updates Quarterly Check for security fixes Password Rotation 90 days All user accounts Storage Health Check Monthly Check HDD/SD card status Backup Configuration After changes Keep multiple versions Camera Cleaning Quarterly Lenses and housings

Reach out to Dahua support for assistance with your CCTV system.

Contact Support

  • 192.168.2.x - PoE camera network (on some NVRs)

items.title: Default Credentials
items.text:
Security Notice

Always change default credentials immediately after first login. These are well-known defaults.

Common DefaultsOlder Models Username Password Access Level admin 4321 Administrator user 1234 Viewer operator 1234 Operator backup 1234 Backup Username Password admin 1111111 admin 123456 admin 4321

items.title: IP Address Assignment
items.text:

# Most devices come with DHCP enabled by default

ipconfig /all      # Windows
ifconfig           # Linux/macOS

1. Access web interface (http://[device-ip])
2. Navigate to Network > TCP/IP
3. Configure settings:
   - IP Address: 192.168.1.x
   - Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0

   - DNS: 8.8.8.8 / 8.8.4.4

items.title: Port Forwarding
items.text:
Security Consideration

Consider using VPN instead of port forwarding for remote access.

Router ConfigurationFirewall Rules 
External Port: 80 (HTTP) or 443 (HTTPS)
Internal Port: 80
Protocol: TCP
Internal IP: [Device IP]

# Allow incoming traffic
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 554 -j ACCEPT

items.title: Initial Setup
items.text:
1. Physical Installation

  • Mount the camera in desired location
  • Connect to power (PoE or separate power supply)
  • Verify network connectivity

2. Device Detection

# Use Wisenet Device Manager to find the camera
# Download from: https://www.hanwhavision.com/support/tools/
# Run as administrator for full functionality

  1. Access web interface at http://[camera-ip]
  2. Complete first-time setup wizard
  3. Set strong admin password

items.title: Camera Settings
items.text:
Video SettingsImage SettingsNetwork Settings 
Resolution: 1080p (1920x1080) or higher
Frame Rate: 15-30 FPS
Bitrate: 4096-8192 kbps
Compression: H.265+ (recommended)

Brightness: 50
Contrast: 50
Saturation: 50
Sharpness: 50
WDR: On (for high-contrast scenes)

IP Assignment: Static (recommended) or DHCP
MTU: 1500 (default)
QoS: Enable for video traffic

items.title: Adding Cameras
items.text:
Before You Begin

Ensure all cameras are properly connected to the network and have been configured with static IPs.

Auto DiscoveryManual Addition 
1. Go to Camera > Registration
2. Click "Auto Search"
3. Select cameras to add
4. Enter camera credentials
5. Click "Add"

1. Go to Camera > Registration
2. Click "Add" > "IP Camera"
3. Enter camera details manually:
   - IP Address
   - Port
   - Protocol (HTTP/HTTPS)
   - Username/Password

RAID: RAID 5 (recommended for redundancy)
HDD Groups:

# Recording Schedule

items.title: Web Interface Access
items.text:
Standard Access 
# Main Web Interface
http://[IP-ADDRESS]

# ONVIF Service
http://[IP-ADDRESS]/onvif/device_service

# RTSP Streams
Main:    rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/profile2/media.smp
Sub:     rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/profile3/media.smp
Mobile:  rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/profile1/media.smp

items.title: Wisenet Device Manager
items.text:
Key Features

  • Device discovery on local network
  • Batch firmware updates
  • Network configuration
  • Password recovery
  • System backup/restore
InstallationCommon Tasks 
# Download from:
https://www.hanwhavision.com/support/tools/

# System Requirements:
- Windows 7/10/11 (64-bit)
- .NET Framework 4.6.1 or later
- 4GB RAM minimum

# Find all devices on network
WisenetDeviceManager.exe /scan

# Update firmware
WisenetDeviceManager.exe /update /ip:192.168.1.100 /file:firmware.bin

# Reset password
WisenetDeviceManager.exe /resetpwd /ip:192.168.1.100

items.title: Common Issues & Solutions
items.text:
Camera Not FoundLogin IssuesVideo Quality Problems

Check these first

  1. Verify power and network cables
  2. Check switch/router port status
  3. Ensure IP is in correct subnet
# Network Diagnostics
ping [CAMERA_IP]
arp -a | findstr [CAMERA_MAC]
nmap -p 80,443,554 [CAMERA_IP]

Security Notice

  • Try default credentials first
  • If locked out, factory reset may be required
  • Document new credentials securely
# Common Defaults
admin / 4321
admin / 123456
admin / 1111111

# Common Fixes:
- Increase bitrate (min 4096 kbps for 1080p)
- Lower frame rate (15 FPS is often sufficient)
- Enable H.265+ compression
- Check network bandwidth
- Verify switch supports Gigabit Ethernet

items.title: Hikvision CCTV Technician Cheatsheet
items.text:
Quick Navigation

  • Default Credentials
  • Network Setup
  • Camera Setup
  • NVR Configuration
  • Troubleshooting
  • Mobile Access

items.title: Quick Reference
items.text:
Network PortsCommon IP Ranges 
# Standard Ports:
HTTP/HTTPS: 80/443
RTSP: 554 (TCP)
ONVIF: 80 (TCP)
RSTP/RTMP: 10554 (TCP)
Hik-Connect P2P: 6500 (TCP)
Server Port: 8000 (TCP)
Mobile Port: 65001 (TCP)
iVMS-4200: 8000 (TCP)

# Default IP Ranges:
192.168.1.64/24 (Common Default)
192.168.0.64/24
192.168.0.0/16 (Common for SMB)
10.0.0.0/8 (Enterprise)
172.16.0.0/12 (Enterprise)

Before You Begin

  • Download SADP Tool
  • Have admin credentials ready
  • Document all IP assignments

items.title: Default Credentials
items.text:
Security Notice

  • Change default credentials immediately after setup
  • Use strong, unique passwords
  • Enable two-factor authentication if available
  • Document credentials securely
Common DefaultsActivation Process 
# Admin Accounts:
admin / 12345 (Older models)
admin / [Activation Code] (Newer models)
admin / admin
admin / 123456

# Operator Account:
operator / 12345 (If enabled)

# Default IP:
192.168.1.64

1. Connect device to network
2. Open SADP Tool
3. Right-click device > Activate
4. Enter activation code (from device label)
5. Set strong admin password
6. Confirm activation

Finding Activation Code

  • Check device label or packaging
  • Format: 5-6 groups of 4 alphanumeric characters
  • Contact Hikvision support if missing

items.title: IP Address Assignment
items.text:
DHCP (Default)Static IP 
# Most devices come with DHCP enabled
# To verify/change:
1. Open SADP Tool
2. Right-click device > Network
3. Check 'Obtain IP address automatically'
4. Click 'Save' and reboot if needed

# Recommended for production:
1. Open SADP Tool
2. Right-click device > Network
3. Select 'Manual' IP assignment
4. Configure:
   - IP Address
   - Subnet Mask
   - Default Gateway
   - Preferred DNS
5. Click 'Save' and reboot

items.title: Port Configuration
items.text:
Port ForwardingPort Configuration via Web UI

Security Consideration

  • Only forward necessary ports
  • Consider using VPN instead
  • Change default ports if possible
# Common Ports to Forward:
- HTTP: 80/TCP
- HTTPS: 443/TCP
- RTSP: 554/TCP
- Mobile: 65001/TCP
- iVMS: 8000/TCP

1. Log in to web interface
2. Go to Configuration > Network > Advanced Settings > More Settings
3. Configure ports as needed
4. Click 'Save' and restart service

items.title: Initial Setup
items.text:
1. Physical Installation

  • Mount the camera in desired location
  • Connect to power (PoE or separate power supply)
  • Verify network connectivity with link lights

2. Device Activation

# Using SADP Tool:
1. Launch SADP Tool
2. Locate uninitialized device (red highlight)
3. Right-click > Activate
4. Set strong admin password (12+ characters)
5. Enter activation code (from device label)

3. Initial Configuration

  1. Access web interface at http://[camera-ip]
  2. Complete first-time setup wizard
  3. Configure network settings (static IP recommended)
  4. Set correct time zone and NTP server
  5. Enable HTTPS for secure access

items.title: Camera Settings
items.text:
Video SettingsImage SettingsNetwork Settings 
# Recommended Settings:
Resolution: 1080p (1920x1080) or higher
Frame Rate: 15-30 FPS
Bitrate: 4096-8192 kbps
Compression: H.265+ (recommended)
I-Frame Interval: 30 (or 2x frame rate)

# Day/Night Settings:
Mode: Auto
ICR: Auto
BLC: On for backlit scenes
WDR: On (adjust level as needed)

# Image Adjustment:
Brightness: 50
Contrast: 50
Saturation: 50
Sharpness: 50

# Recommended Configuration:
IP Assignment: Static
MTU: 1500 (default)
QoS: Enable for video traffic
HTTP/HTTPS Port: 80/443
RTSP Port: 554

items.title: Adding Cameras
items.text:
Before You Begin

  • Ensure all cameras are on the same network
  • Verify camera credentials
  • Check firmware compatibility
Auto DiscoveryManual Addition 
1. Go to Camera > IP Camera
2. Click 'Auto Search'
3. Select cameras to add
4. Enter camera credentials
5. Click 'Add'

1. Go to Camera > IP Camera > Manual Add
2. Enter camera details:
   - IP Address
   - Port (default: 80/HTTP, 443/HTTPS)
   - Protocol: HIKVISION, ONVIF, or RTSP
   - Username/Password

items.title: Storage & Recording
items.text:
Storage SetupRecording Settings 
# Storage Configuration:
HDD Management: RAID 5 (recommended for redundancy)
HDD Groups: 
  - Group 1: Cameras 1-8 (if using multiple HDDs)
  - Group 2: Cameras 9-16

# Recording Schedule:
- Continuous: 24/7 for critical areas
- Motion: For storage efficiency
- Event: For specific triggers

# Recommended Settings:
- Pre-record: 5 seconds
- Post-record: 10 seconds
- Record Audio: Enable if needed
- Enable H.265+ for better compression
- Adjust bitrate based on storage needs

items.title: Live View Configuration
items.text:
# View Layouts:
- 1x1, 2x2, 3x3, 4x4, 5+1, 6+4, 8+0, etc.
- Custom layouts available

# Display Options:
- Digital Zoom: Up to 16x
- PTZ Controls: On-screen joystick
- Audio: Two-way audio support
- Tour: Create camera tours

items.title: Web Interface Access
items.text:
Standard Access 
# Main Web Interface
http://[IP-ADDRESS]

# ONVIF Service
http://[IP-ADDRESS]/onvif/device_service

# RTSP Streams
Main:    rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/Streaming/Channels/101
Sub:     rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/Streaming/Channels/102
Third:   rtsp://[USER]:[PASS]@[IP]:554/Streaming/Channels/103

items.title: SADP Tool
items.text:
Key Features

  • Device discovery and management
  • Device activation and password reset
  • Network configuration
  • Firmware upgrades
  • Batch configuration
InstallationCommon Tasks 
# Download from:
https://www.hikvision.com/en/support/tools/hitools/

# System Requirements:
- Windows 7/10/11 (64-bit)
- .NET Framework 4.6.1 or later
- 4GB RAM minimum

# Find all Hikvision devices on network
SADP.exe /scan

# Reset IP address
SADP.exe /ip:192.168.1.100 /newip:192.168.1.101

# Reset password (if enabled)
SADP.exe /resetpwd /ip:192.168.1.100

items.title: Common Issues & Solutions
items.text:
Camera Not FoundLogin IssuesVideo Quality Problems

Check these first

  1. Verify power and network cables
  2. Check switch/router port status
  3. Ensure IP is in correct subnet
# Network Diagnostics
ping [CAMERA_IP]
arp -a | findstr [CAMERA_MAC]
nmap -p 80,443,554 [CAMERA_IP]

# Check if device needs activation
# (Appears in SADP with red highlight)

Security Notice

  • Try default credentials first
  • If locked out, use SADP for password reset
  • Document new credentials securely
# Common Defaults:
admin / 12345
admin / [Activation Code]
admin / admin
admin / 123456

# Common Fixes:
- Increase bitrate (min 4096 kbps for 1080p)
- Lower frame rate (15 FPS is often sufficient)
- Enable H.265+/Smart Codec
- Check network bandwidth
- Verify switch supports Gigabit Ethernet
- Adjust WDR/BLC settings for challenging lighting

items.title: Factory Reset Procedures
items.text:
CamerasNVRs 
1. Locate reset button (pinhole)
2. Press and hold for 30+ seconds
3. Wait for IR LEDs to blink
4. Release and wait for reboot

1. Power off the NVR
2. Press and hold reset button
3. Power on while holding button
4. Continue holding for 30 seconds
5. Release and wait for boot

items.title: Log Collection
items.text:
For Technical Support

Always collect these logs when opening a support case:

# System Logs
http://[IP]/ISAPI/System/log

# Event Logs
http://[IP]/ISAPI/Event/notification/alertStream

# Network Configuration
http://[IP]/ISAPI/System/Network

items.title: Browser Compatibility
items.text: Browser Supported Notes Chrome ✓ Recommended Firefox ✓ Edge ✓ Safari ✓ Some features limited Mobile Chrome ✓ Mobile Safari ✓ Some features limited

items.title: Update Procedure
items.text:
Important

Always backup configuration before updating firmware. Never power off during update.

Web InterfaceSADP Tool 
1. Download firmware from Hikvision Support
2. Log in to web interface
3. Go to Maintenance > System > System Maintenance > Upgrade
4. Upload firmware file
5. Click "Upgrade" and wait for completion

1. Select device in SADP
2. Right-click > Upgrade
3. Select firmware file
4. Click "Start Upgrade"
5. Monitor progress and wait for reboot

items.title: Version Compatibility
items.text: Device Type Minimum Version Recommended Version DS-2CD2XXX V5.5.82 V5.7.3 DS-76XXNI V4.22.005 V4.30.085 DS-96XXNI V4.22.005 V4.30.085

items.title: Hik-Connect Setup
items.text:
Best Practices

  • Use Hik-Connect for easy remote access
  • Enable 2FA for security
  • Configure push notifications
  • Set up motion detection alerts
Setup GuideTroubleshooting 
1. Install Hik-Connect from App Store/Play Store
2. Create Hik-Connect account
3. Tap "+" to add device
4. Choose connection method:
   - Scan QR code (easiest)
   - Manual entry (Serial/QR code)
   - IP/Domain
5. Enter credentials
6. Save and connect

# Common Issues:
- Port forwarding not configured
- Firewall blocking connection
- Incorrect credentials
- Firmware version mismatch
- Hik-Connect service not enabled

# Test Connection:
- Verify port is open: telnet [IP] [PORT]
- Check router logs
- Test with mobile data (bypass local network)

items.title: Security Checklist
items.text:
Essential Security Measures

  • Change default passwords
  • Enable HTTPS
  • Update firmware regularly
  • Use strong user passwords
  • Enable account lockout
  • Disable unused services (UPnP, P2P if not needed)
  • Enable logging
  • Regular backups

items.title: Maintenance ScheduleNeed Help?
items.text:
Task Frequency Notes Firmware Updates Quarterly Check for security fixes Password Rotation 90 days All user accounts Storage Health Check Monthly Check HDD/SD card status Backup Configuration After changes Keep multiple versions Camera Cleaning Quarterly Lenses and housings

Reach out to Hikvision support for assistance with your CCTV system.
